qas.question: Who was the leader of the East Prussian Nazi Party?
What large plans did Koch have?

answers.text: mass-scale industrialization of the largely agricultural province

qas.question: What even occurred during the summer of 1932 in Konigsberg?

answers.text: attack on the headquarters of the Social Democrats

qas.question: Who was killed in the attack of the Social Democrats?
In what year did Konigsberger Volkszeitung become an executive editor?
In what year did Kurt Kotzan become the Reichsbanner Chairman of Lotzen?
Who was the local Reichsbanner Chairman of Konigsberg?
In what year did Max von Bahrfeldt become a politician for the German People's Party?
In what year did the East Prussian Nazi party form?

context: <a0_0>Erich Koch<a0_0/> headed the East Prussian Nazi party from <b4_0><b7_0><b8_0>1928<b8_0/><b7_0/><b4_0/>. He led the district from <b5_0>1932<b5_0/>. This period was characterized by efforts to collectivize the local agriculture and ruthlessness in dealing with his critics inside and outside the Party. He also had long-term plans for <a1_0>mass-scale industrialization of the largely agricultural province<a1_0/>. These actions made him unpopular among the local peasants. In 1932 the local paramilitary SA had already started to terrorise their political opponents. On the night of 31 July 1932 there was a bomb <a2_0>attack on the headquarters of the Social Democrats<a2_0/> in Königsberg, the Otto-Braun-House. The Communist politician <a3_0>Gustav Sauf<a3_0/> was killed; the executive editor of the Social Democrat "Königsberger Volkszeitung", Otto Wyrgatsch, and the German People's Party politician <b6_0>Max von Bahrfeldt<b6_0/> were severely injured. Members of the Reichsbanner were attacked and the local Reichsbanner Chairman of Lötzen, Kurt Kotzan, was murdered on 6 August 1932.
